intro: Argostemma psychotrioides, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some areas.
